intro: Pluchea pteropoda, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as marshes and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Pluchea pteropoda is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
